metadata.case_name: Adopted son of Krishnarao (Appellant/Plaintiff) v. Sons of Devji (Respondents/Defendants 1-3)

facts.text: Siddopant and Krishnarao were members of a joint undivided family, sons of Ramchandra, entitled to half share of Watan lands: whole of S. No. 138 and half of Nos. 133, 136 in Ukamnal; half of S. Nos. 163, 164, 168 in Katakanhalli.
Krishnarao died in 1897 leaving widow Rukminibai (D-6).
Siddopant died in 1899 leaving son Gundo, who died in 1901 leaving widow Laxmibai (D-5).
On 16th December 1901, Laxmibai adopted Devji, who died on 6th September 1935 leaving three sons (D1-3: Narayan, Raghavendra, Gundo) and widow Akkubai (D-4).
On 26th April 1944, Rukminibai adopted the plaintiff.
Plaintiff instituted suit for partition on 29th June 1944 claiming half share in family properties as representing Krishnarao.

Siddopant purchased house under Ex. D-36 (21-5-1871, Rs.200); lands S.No.23 Ukamnal under Ex.D-61 (11-5-1885, Rs.475); S.Nos.2025,2140 under Ex.D-64 (23-7-1890, Rs.2400); constructed two houses on S.Nos.639-641 and 634-635 (cost Rs.20-25k). Devji built house on 642,644,645 (cost Rs.2-4k). Total investment ~Rs.30k.
Swamirao (other branch) died ~1903 issueless, his widow died shortly after; properties (Sch.C) devolved on Devji as nearest agnate.
Watan lands ~56 acres, annual assessment Rs.49; income estimated low (trial court Rs.150, HC not considerable; enough for maintenance?). Siddopant Tahsildar in Hyderabad 40yrs, retired on pension.
Both lower courts held adoption valid (not disputed); purchases/houses by Siddopant/Devji self-acquisitions; no half share in S.639/640; Sch.C to Devji exclusively; no blending.
HC decreed partition of Watan lands, dismissed rest.
Documents (judgments in maintenance suits by Rukminibai: CS 445/1903, 177/1941 etc.) produced late 17-7-1946, rejected under O.XIII r2.

House sites: S.634/635 (sanads D45/46 recognize prior occupation); 639/640/641 (no title for 639, sanads D47/48 similar); 642/644/645 (sanads D49-51 similar); 622 purchased by Devji 1909 auction D43; 643 temple.

legal_issues.text: Whether properties purchased by Siddopant and houses constructed by him and Devji (Sch.A/B) were self-acquisitions or acquired with joint family funds/nucleus from Watan lands; correct burden of proof.
Whether certain documents (maintenance suit judgments) wrongly rejected as inadmissible.
Whether house sites without title deeds (S.634/5,639/40/41,642/4/5) are ancestral properties.
Whether plaintiff by adoption to Krishnarao can divest Devji/sons of Sch.C properties inherited from Swamirao (collateral); scope of relation back doctrine.
Whether Sch.C properties blended with joint family properties.

petitioner_arguments.text: Nucleus from ancestral Watan lands (56 acres) presumes acquisitions with joint funds; burden on defendants to prove self-acquisition without joint aid.
Maintenance suit judgments admissible under Evidence Act s.13 as assertions of joint family properties.
House sites without title deeds presumed ancestral; entitled to half share.
By adoption, preferential heir to Swamirao; divests Devji of Sch.C properties via relation back.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Anant Bhikappa Patil v. Shankar Ramchandra Patil (70 IA 232)

petitioner_arguments.text: Sch.C properties blended with joint family properties.

respondent_arguments.text: Acquisitions self-acquisitions; insufficient nucleus (low income from Watan); plaintiff failed initial burden.
Documents produced late; inadmissible under Evidence Act ss.40-44; irrelevance to title.
No divestment of Sch.C properties inherited from collateral; relation back not applicable.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Jivaji Annaji v. Hanmant Ramchandra (ILR 1950 Bom 510)

court_reasoning.text: Watan income insufficient nucleus (not even for maintenance); plaintiff failed initial burden to show joint family funds aided acquisitions; even if burden shifted, defendants discharged it via Siddopant's service income.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Income from 56 acres low (assessment Rs.49); acquisitions Rs.30k; Tahsildar salary/pension source.

court_reasoning.text: Documents admissible under Ev. Act s.13 but properly rejected for late production under O.XIII r.2; reopening would prolong trial.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Produced after evidence closed; defendants needed rebuttal opportunity.

court_reasoning.text: House sites without title deeds/pattas confirming prior family possession presumed ancestral (sanads recognize occupation); half share/value to plaintiff: S.634/5,639/40/41,642/4/5.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No title deeds = presume ancestral unless rebutted.

court_reasoning.text: Relation back applies only to adoptive father's estate, not collaterals; overrules Anant Bhikappa Patil on collateral inheritance (leads to inconvenient results, no abeyance of inheritance); Sch.C not divestable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Fiction of continuity for adoptive father's line only; inheritance vests immediately, not divested by later adoption to collateral.

court_reasoning.text: No blending proved; concurrent findings against plaintiff.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Heavy burden on plaintiff not discharged.

holdings.text: Plaintiff must prove joint family nucleus aided acquisitions; here insufficient, properties self-acquired except specified sites.
Documents rejected validly for late production.
House sites sans title deeds ancestral; plaintiff entitled to half value.
Adopted son cannot divest vested collateral inheritance via relation back.

precedents_cited.relevance: Burden of proof on nucleus for joint family acquisitions.

precedents_cited.case_name: Anant Bhikappa Patil Minor v. Shankar Ramchandra Patil
precedents_cited.relevance: Relation back for joint family and collaterals; court holds unsound for collaterals.
No divestment of collateral inheritance by later adoption.
Relation back for continuity of line.
Adoption validity/divestment of adoptive father's estate.
No divestment of collateral inheritance by later adoption.
Adopted son divests widow of adoptive father's estate.
Coparcenary ceases on last coparcener's death.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Evidence Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Admissibility of judgments as assertions of joint property; relevance to title.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed in part: plaintiff granted decree for partition of admitted Watan lands and half value of ancestral house sites S.Nos. 634/635, 639/640/641, 642/644/645 as on suit date; Sch.A/B purchases/houses and Sch.C properties held self-acquired/no claim; suit otherwise dismissed.
outcome.relief_granted: Half share in Watan lands; half value of specified house sites.

key_quotes.text: "Proof of the existence of a joint family does not lead to the presumption that property held by any member of the family is joint, and the burden rests upon anyone asserting that any item of property was joint to establish the fact."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: States law on burden for joint family property claims (from Appalaswami).

key_quotes.text: "The important thing to consider is the income which the nucleus yields."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: Anant Bhikappa Patil Minor v. Shankar Ramchandra Patil "in so far as it relates to properties inherited from collaterals is not sound".
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Overruling precedent on relation back scope.

key_quotes.text: "Legal fictions should not be extended so as to lead to unjust results."
key_quotes.speaker: court
